feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [monolog/monolog] Monolog Header injection in NativeMailerHandler
entry.content:
A header injection vulnerability has been identified in the NativeMailerHandler of the Monolog library. This vulnerability may allow an attacker to manipulate email headers when log messages are sent via email.

References

  • https://github.com/Seldaek/monolog/issues/458
  • https://github.com/Seldaek/monolog/pull/448#issuecomment-68208704
  • https://github.com/Seldaek/monolog/commit/515a096c864b00b3967f7f601680f85d4a2e4001
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/monolog/monolog/2014-12-29-1.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f57v-q966-7fh6

entry.title: [mediawiki/core] Mediawiki tarball is missing .htaccess files
entry.content:
Mediawiki 1.31 before 1.31.1 misses .htaccess files in the provided tarball used to protect some directories that shouldn't be web accessible.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-13258
  • https://lists.wikimedia.org/pipermail/wikitech-l/2018-September/090849.html
  • https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T199029
  • http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1041695
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/mediawiki/core/CVE-2018-13258.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2c28-7gwv-cpgf

entry.title: [mediawiki/core] Mediawiki Improper Privilege Management
entry.content:
Mediawiki 1.31 before 1.31.1, 1.30.1, 1.29.3 and 1.27.5 contains a flaw where contrary to the documentation, $wgRateLimits entry for 'user' overrides that for 'newbie'.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-0503
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3142
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3238
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3813
  • https://lists.wikimedia.org/pipermail/wikitech-l/2018-September/090849.html
  • https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T169545
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4301
  • http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1041695
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/mediawiki/core/CVE-2018-0503.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mhfv-9h99-jwg7

entry.title: [mediawiki/core] Mediawiki information disclosure vulnerability
entry.content:
Mediawiki 1.31 before 1.31.1, 1.30.1, 1.29.3 and 1.27.5 contains an information disclosure flaw in the Special:Redirect/logid

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-0504
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3238
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3813

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hr8v-f4g2-p66f

entry.title: [mediawiki/core] Mediawiki BotPassword can bypass CentralAuth's account lock
entry.content:
Mediawiki 1.31 before 1.31.1, 1.30.1, 1.29.3 and 1.27.5 contains a flaw where BotPasswords can bypass CentralAuth's account lock

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-0505
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3142
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3238
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3813

  • https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T194605
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4301
  • http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1041695

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5c6w-f4w2-2grp

entry.title: [mediawiki/core] MediaWiki Open Redirect vulnerability
entry.content:
resources/src/mediawiki.page.ready/ready.js in MediaWiki before 1.34.0-rc.0 allows remote attackers to force a logout and external redirection via HTML content in a MediaWiki page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-10959
  • https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/mediawiki/core/+/536725
  • https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T232932
  • https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T240393
  • https://github.com/wikimedia/mediawiki/commit/d4a552e65bdfd7309a9b8537e9dbe69c5e2991eb
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/mediawiki/core/CVE-2020-10959.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mqhw-wq8p-vf5r

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Cross-Site Scripting via admin panel
entry.content:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user can manipulate downloadable link and cause an invocation of error handling that acceses user input without sanitization.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8157
  • https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/magento/product-community-edition/CVE-2019-8157.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vrw4-34p5-pjg5

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Cross-Site Scripting via admin panel
entry.content:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user can manipulate downloadable link and cause an invocation of error handling that acceses user input without sanitization.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8157

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vrw4-34p5-pjg5

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Broken authentication and session managememt
entry.content:
Insecure authentication and session management vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An unauthenticated user can append arbitrary session id that will not be invalidated by subsequent authentication.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8149
  • https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/magento/product-community-edition/CVE-2019-8149.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8mwx-wpp4-5xh4

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Injection vulnerability via email templates
entry.content:
A SQL injection vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with access to email templates can send malicious SQL queries and obtain access to sensitive information stored in the database.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8143
  • https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/magento/product-community-edition/CVE-2019-8143.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-94q8-gx29-6mqv
